Austrian industry ’ s mood accelerated its decline relative to the eurozone in August .
The purchasing management index ( PMI ) was at a 37-month low with 46.7 points .
Across Europe , Austria still has the third best mood behind Ireland and the Netherlands , the Markit Institute announced on Monday for its survey of 3,000 companies .
Unlike in Austria , the euro zone ’ s PMI rose by 1.1 points to 45.1 points , but the index remains below the 50 meter mark for the 13th consecutive month .
Only Ireland 's industry broke this threshold in August with 50.9 points .
At the bottom were the Greeks ( 42.1 points ) .
In Germany , France , and Spain , the mood barometer fell , but slower than in previous months .
In Spain , the index reached 44.0 points at the highest level since March .
The slightly diluted decline may well mean that the worst is over ,  Markit economist Rob Dobson said .
But industry remains the number one growth brake - at least in the third quarter .
There is no prospect of a rapid return to the growth zone : export orders in the eurozone have plummeted as much as they have since November 2011 .
